item.description:
Note that the originally scheduled talk by Chris Reddy of Woods Hole has been postponed to a later date.  In his place will be Welkin Johnson discussing replication of HIV-like viruses.

It's the second Tuesday of April, and you know what that means - Science by the Pint!  Join us again at Tavern in the Square for suds and cutting edge research, as Welkin Johnson and his lab members discuss how viruses like HIV replicate.  And of course there'll be the usual one on one mingling and questions for the scientists.

This time the restaurant manager knows what we're up to (hopefully), so seating should be better managed.  But nonetheless, trying to reserve large blocks of space just doesn't seem to work at that place.  So just come by early if you can and look for folks.  I'll be there about 6:15 with a Meetup sign at one table at least, and whoever shows up early can help garner a few more.  Once again, curtain time is 7:00, and getting settled ahead of time gives you a chance to get food and foam in front of you :)

Again, T/SQ is just a few blocks south down Mass Ave from the Porter T Stop (in the direction of Harvard).  And if you must drive, you're responsible for your own parking search squad.

Hope to see you there, and cheers!

https://sitn.hms.harvard.edu/

http://www.taverninthesquare.com/tavporter/

 

From SITN:

Science by the Pint is back in full force for its second season
at a new venue, the Tavern in the Square in Porter Square.
Science by the Pint is SITN's own science cafe - a fun,
informal event where scientists mingle with the general public
to talk about their research, why they do it, and how it
affects the world. Join us the second Tuesday of each month
from 7-9pm.
item.name: Science by the Pint: Welkin Johnson on Virus Replication
